description:
self. _fetch_image needs context in argments.
But this line doesn't pass the context.
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/diablo/nova/virt/libvirt/connection.py#L935
title: missing context paramter in _ cache_image on nova.virt.libvirt.connection

comments.content:
self. _fetch_image needs context in argments.
But this line doesn't pass the context.
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/diablo/nova/virt/libvirt/connection.py#L935
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~nati-ueno

comments.content: Can't find the affected code at that line. Could you quote it ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content:
Now lives on line 948 (stable/diablo):
       if config_drive_id:
            fname = '%08x' % int(config_drive_id)
            self._cache_image(fn=self._fetch_image,
                              target=basepath('disk.config'),
                              fname=fname,
                              image_id=config_drive_id,
                              user_id=inst['user_id'],
                              project_id=inst['project_id'],)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content:
And affects Essex (line 1019):
        if config_drive_id:
            fname = config_drive_id
            self._cache_image(fn=libvirt_utils.fetch_image,
                              target=basepath('disk.config'),
                              fname=fname,
                              image_id=config_drive_id,
                              user_id=inst['user_id'],
                              project_id=inst['project_id'],)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: Nominated for Diablo in case someone wants to backport a fix but marked as not a bug for master
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~russellb
